newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank, Sony, News to have equal JSkyB stake.
newsitem.headline: Softbank, Sony, News to have equal JSkyB stake.

text.p: Softbank Corp said on Tuesday that the satellite broadcasting venture Japan Sky Broadcasting (JSkyB) would be owned equally by Sony Corp, Softbank and News Corp.
JSkyB is scheduled to start beaming 12 channels into Japan in April, and plans to increase that number to 150 channels by April 1998.

A Softbank spokesman said earlier that the three were considering Sony's capital participation in the venture as well as a possible role for it in providing audiovisual software and broadcasting equipment.

Softbank president Masayoshi Son was also quoted as saying that the company plans to become the holding company for its group firms when Japanese regulations are changed to allow for the setting up of holding companies.
